column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: flower, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Invaga worked for me the first two months  Then just recently I gained weight in my abdomen area real fast and am suffering other side effets. They are extreme fatigue, feeling anxious,very worried,depressed, numbness in hands and feet, sore muscles, blurry vision and frequent urination. I am not sure why this has occured. I am going through a really hard time also. My father is not feeling good at times and I get so upset cause he is very important to me. Also my hus band says he will be leaving me to go home to his country which will leave me in charge of finances and a new place to live. They say stress can cause depression. I am seeking the help of my psychologist and my aunts,Dad,cousins,Uncle and my sister.  I think also my sleep schedule is off. I don't go to bed until real late and sleep in alot. The weight gain from the invega worries me the most its about 40 pounds. My doctor told me Invega is not a weight gaining drug and that is not true bcause I WAS VERY THIN IN THE BEGINNING. My husband puts me down cause of my weight and that makes me depressed. I really was doing better when I was fourty pounds less. I had more energy then. But that was also before I got the news of my Dads serious condition and my husband saying hes leaving in the future. Im going to review the effectiveness of Invega and side effects with my Pschiatrist as soon as possible. I have appointment on June  6.
just prescribed for my daughter and i am wanting to get some more information

column2: Amanda, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: doinmybest, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication is a life saver for me. It controls my deep, dark depressions, paranoia, and delusions. I was initially taking Risperdal, which caused me to develop tremors.  Invega provides me with the same results as Risperdal without the side effect of tremors. I was initially taking 6 mg a day but started to suffer from mood swings and paranoia. I am currently on 9 mg and am doing fantastic. I am very pleased with the effects of this medication and would recommend it to anyone suffering from bipolar disorder. I initially gained 20 lb while taking it but I am now carefully watching what I eat and exercising and the weight is slowly coming off.

column2: nightrockerplus, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Invega 9mg for about 3 years now. I am 49 and have had bad bi-polar since I was 7.  I have literally tried all the drugs out there.  This is the only one, besides Depakote (1750mg daily,) and Klonopin (6mg, daily) to slow my manic episodes down.  I don't like the weight gain, as I have gained 25 lbs. even with heavy exercise.. column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed

column2: college student, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: While taking 6mg of this drug I was doing very well until stress in my life happened and I started to become very paranoid again and have extremely intrusive and bizarre thoughts. Invega makes me very drowsy initially after taking the pill so I take it at nighttime. Underlying drowsiness throughout the day. I am able to go to college and do all my work well. Do not feel like a zombie like on other anti-psychotics. Has been a good experience for me. Earned a 3.7 GPA last semester in upper-division classes.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: rem, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Bipolar I disorder almost exactly 6 years ago (I was 20).  I've gone through about 7 doctors and even more medications.  The dosage that has finally been successful the past 2 years has been lithium, lamictal, and invega.  I used to take geodon, but my personal feelings of distress (more physical than anything else) made me beg for something else.  And then, whala!  A new drug called invega.  I soon was able to study for school better, my relationship with my then girlfriend now wife went to new heights; I even have been able to sustain a job for the past two years, all while buying my first home at 25 and a new car.  I truly attribute invega for giving me the stability to be myself again.

column9: This drug has effectively treated my mania and has seemed to have given me some balance and clarity psychologically. I'm not paranoid and my thoughts are not racing at all. I was on abilify, and I went out of the range of abilify and fell into a manic phase for several months. To say the least it was horrible. My current doctor put me on invega and I like the fact that I seem to be more sound and not manic or paranoid. However, now I am very sluggish and lazy. I feel depressed and I have gained a lot of weight.  My body just seems to me weighed down all the time. I also easily get indigestion now. I am also lacking focus and have a terrible time doing basic tasks like getting dressed of doing the laundry. I take it in the morning along with an anti-anxiety medication. I'm going to talk to my doctor about all of the side effects that I am experiencing to see if there is another medicine out there for me. It would be great if I could find a drug that gave me the balance and clarity of invega and the pep that I got from abilify. I had no weight gain when I was on abilify.

column2: lizgiz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i took 3mg. then 6mg. for total of 4mo. I went to my gynocologist because I was lactating and he immed. ordered a brain MRI. I now have a pituitary tumor (prolactinoma). I had prolactin lvls. of 89.6 while on Invega, dropping to 5.2 after only 2 weeks off it. No one told me that this could happen, even info on the net didn't mention this. I also am on Metformin now because of the high blood sugar s/e, now permanent. I had Tardive Dyskenesia in hands; it went away. I have permanent sun sensitivity. Obviously, for me, the benefits didn't outweigh the risks. I have changed doctors, part of the problem, and now take Lamictal. I have had no s/e and it is working good. I guess I'm one of the people that Invega DIDN"T work for!

column9: I've taken many different medications for my Bipolar disorder which cause me to have bad mood swings, and very moody , I've tried lithum , depakote and within a week I had to stop takeing them because of rashs and some side effects , So my doctor just started me on 3mg.of Invega once a day , I've been on it for 8 days now and have noticed a real change in mood and behavior , the only problem is I'm haveing the prolactin side effect , I was thought something was wrong homoneal wise , when my breasts started leaking large amounts of what looks like milk , I didn't know that was a side effect until I called my doctor. Has anyone else had this happen to them so quickly after starting treatment? Should I be worried , the doctor says I should not worry but I'm the worry wart , I also take 4mg. of Xanax a day . I"m 42 and had my last child when I was 23 , so to see my breasts leaking , I really freaked out.

column1: A Rare Developmental Disorder of Infants
column2: tcpbcp, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Our 17yo duaghter had been taking Risperdal for 12 years prior to her doctor switching to Invega 5 weeks ago because of the weight gain with the Risperdal. She takes 9mg daily. At first she took it mornings, but found it made her tired so she switched to evenings and finds it helps her rest better and she is not as tired during the day. Not as many mood swings and her attitude is much happier and upbeat. Appetite is down, but weight is still holding.

column2: terri, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Invega 6 mg since the beginning of Sept 08.  Currently,I am experiencing joint and muscle soreness.  I'm unsure, but I may be experiencing diarrhea as well.  My doctor prescribed Cogentin (2 mg) to relieve my joint and muscle pain.  I've only taken it for 4 days,but have seen considerable improvement. Since taking the Cogentin, I have seen a remarkable improvement to my mental outlook.  My diarrhea also seems much better.  Whether or not this is due tothe Cogentin, I don't know.  While taking Invega with 100 mg of Seroquel, I experienced anxiety and my mental outlook was poor.  I always looked at the negative side of things and fixated on the worst possible scenario.  It's unclear as to whether or not my psychiatrist will keep me on Invega.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: One-pill-a-day to treat symptoms of anxiety and depression.  I have yet to experience any side effects with this medication.  I do, at times, suffer from insomnia, but still manage to sleep even if at odd times of the day or night.  The control-release substance makes it easy to take the pill if one cannot stick to a regulated daily time schedule for taking medication.  I always feel better, more alert and more focussed within one hour after taking this medication.  I have not experienced any additional side effects and am not certain if the insomnia is caused by Invega or if it is simply caused by life itself.

beachnutt, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Because of drug abuse as a teen I developed audio hallucinations.  I was put on a drug called Serentil and was on it for over 25 years. I took 50mg per day. I was fine all my adult life then they stopped making the drug.  I tried everything-Geodon-Seroquel-Resperdal-Melleril and others.  Nothing worked.  Finally I changed docs and he put me on Invega-3mg-didn't work then 6mg-better but still not the best then 9mg-great.  No more voices and I don't have any side effects.  Only problem is over the 3 years of trying different meds I developed constant anxiety. My doc put me on Xanax ER.  Which may not be the best for someone who used to use drugs but, I haven't used since age 20 and I'm 47 now.  No side effects with Xanax ER either. And I still have slight anxiety but, I live with it.  As for the weight gain  on Invega I don't have it but, I have a very physical job so that may have something to do with it.  I also tried Depakote and gained 25# in 2 months.  The most important thing is no voices and I can live a "normal" life.  After 3 years of trying Thank God for Invega.

If anyone knows if this will subside with time or my body's adjusting, please respond here. I will follow up for you, too.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: Dennis, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: When I first started taking this medicine I was extremely anxious. I noticed a twitching in my toes and fingers. This minor twitching has continued for the 6 months I have been on it.  I could not sleep when I first started taking it, but was hospitalized for 5 days because I couldn't sleep. I had a tough time trying to get to sleep and when I finally did sleep I sweated greatly!  The sleep problems went away and my behavior was fine for about 5 1/2 months. Now the sleep problems are startng again.  It seems I have slight problems breating and the tingling /twithching in my toes and feet are more severe.  I get real thirsty and drink lots of water.  It as if the systems in my body are shutting down and adrenalin is being pumped into my blood to keep my systems going which in turn keeps me awake.  The drug seems to calm me down but only for a short period of time after taking it. They just uped me from 6 mg to 9mg two days ago.  We will see how it goes.

column2: lislis777, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The initial 45 days on Invega was awesome, and the meds seemed to take affect rather quickly. I felt somewhat more manic than balanced,but, at least I was more positive in my thoughts/emotions. Than, because our society tends to think in terms of "more is better," my therapist increased from 3 mg to the next level of 6 mg and, subsequently, I crashed and burned almost as immediately into the negatives as I had during initially taking the meds. After about 2-3 weeks of decreasing mood, depressions that I had not felt in a long time, I got word to him about the change and he told me to go back to the 3 mg. I did, but the negatives remained so I did the drastic and stopped altogether. However, I have been off them just 2 days, again with no change, but just retook my dose this second after reading all the rad success stories on here. I know meds act differently for each person, but I also know I am obnoxiously impatient and it is soooo difficult to wait out the meds before feeling better.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: MiPolar, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was so at ease or level minded almost too good to be true. Well it was, the swelling in my legs & feet were the worst, my whole body suffered too even my face! I started this medication March 06,2008 and taken off of it March 24,2008. I ended up on Furosemide 20mg tab 1@2xpd. The pain in my spine and hips is unbearable, can't walk, this all brings me to tears. Diagnosed 12 yrs ago, trial and error so many times and NEVER had this happen. Back to the Doc 03/26/08...I guess I'll keep you "posted". If this does anything, helping someone like the other one I read about her swelling, then I did something good today. Brenda D.

hypersad, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It took effect rather quickly; I noticed changes in my attitude within a week.  I was more positive and upbeat.  However the draw backs are that the effects seem to taper off QUICKLY at the end of the night, which works out because it seems to make me very tired at night.  Also I have noticed that I am very thirsty and rather cold(temp sensitive now) almost all the time. So I need to carry around a bottle of water and wear long underwear, and wrap up in blankets/sit near space heaters more often.

My physician has just put me on this medication but in the week I have been taking it, I have found myself having a more postive attitude; since medications given for mental illness tend to take a few weeks to work, I am confident I will continue to improve my mood and attitude as I continue with this medication.
